channel.title: Path and class path help
channel.description: alright so im jailbreaking my ps3 and doing various things to my computer for server / rs stuff and i go to do ipconfig in my cmd box and it says not internal or external recognized, most of you have heard this a million times, im running jre 7 update 1 the newest and im going to download the newest jdk right now. im currently running windows xp i just need my classpath and path to be set so i can run my cmd box ipconfig to get my ipv4 adress, help quickly please and im running now jdk 7 u 2

Anyways, techooo. I will try to explain this to the best of my ability.

Waste of time, look at technoos posts. Same thing for almost every post.

item.title: Path and class path help
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:10, topic:425349”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=528012.msg3849974#msg3849974 date=1323928039]

Because you need Java to use ipconfig…

You need java to run command prompt.
[/quote]Oh ya. If Java is misconfigured the command prompt will run, but it won’t let you use ipconfig.[/quote]

I’m glad you see that all of your inutile sarcasm is pushing the productivity of this thread.

Anyways, techooo. I will try to explain this to the best of my ability. Your command prompt obviously executes certain commands, but it needs to know where the commands are located. In Windows, your path variables dictate this. I would assume that when you were configuring your path for Java, you erased everything and inserted the directory to your development kit or whatever. What you will need to do is add the location to your System32 folder to the end of your path variable, because “ipconfig” is located in the System32 folder, and command prompt needs to know to check there for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Path and class path help
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:2, topic:425349”]Because you need Java to use ipconfig…[/quote]wat

did u try running cmd as administrator that works for me when i get that problem (on windows).

you’re on windows, so if that doesn’t work, you need to add the windows folder and the system32 folder to your path variable because that’s where it is located, i think. i don’t use windows often, so good luck.

Read full topic
